title: CLAUDE.md
text:
This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.


This is a Quarto-based academic website for Virtuelle Akademie, built as a static site generator that outputs to GitHub Pages. The site features a dual-purpose structure with both a main website and a sub-project (virtuelleakademie/) that appears to be a blog-style section.



The project uses Quarto’s website format with these key components:

Main site: Academic website with Teaching, Research, and About sections
Sub-project: Blog-style section in virtuelleakademie/ directory

Output: Static HTML generated to docs/ directory for GitHub Pages
Styling: Custom SCSS themes with Nunito Sans/Inter fonts and purple branding (#4b2e83)
Extensions: Multiple Quarto extensions including timer, custom-callout, pyodide, fontawesome, etc.





_quarto.yml: Main site configuration with navbar, sidebar, and page structure
virtuelleakademie/_quarto.yml: Sub-project configuration for blog section
styles/: SCSS files for custom styling and themes
posts/: Blog posts with metadata
teaching/, research/, about/: Main content sections
docs/: Generated output directory (do not edit directly)






quarto render



quarto preview



quarto render --clean



make branch name=feature-name    # Create new branch
make commit msg="Description"    # Add and commit changes  
make push                        # Push current branch
make merge                       # Admin: merge to main





New blog posts go in posts/ directory as .qmd files
Teaching content uses sidebar navigation defined in _quarto.yml
Research sections follow the same sidebar pattern
All content uses Quarto markdown format with YAML frontmatter




The site uses a custom purple theme (#4b2e83) with sophisticated typography and animations. The main stylesheet is styles/custom.scss which defines:

Typography hierarchy with Inter/Nunito Sans fonts
Card-based layouts with hover effects
Gradient animations and smooth transitions
Responsive grid systems




The site heavily uses Quarto extensions for enhanced functionality: - timer: Interactive timers for presentations - custom-callout: Enhanced callout boxes - fontawesome: Icon support - pyodide: Python code execution in browser - live: Interactive code cells




The Makefile provides convenient git workflow commands
The site outputs to docs/ for GitHub Pages hosting
Two separate _quarto.yml files manage different site sections
Custom SCSS compilation handles the sophisticated styling system

title: Courses
text:
Semester: Spring 2024 | Level: Graduate | Credits: 3

An advanced course exploring the integration of artificial intelligence technologies in educational systems, covering machine learning applications, personalized learning, and ethical considerations.




Semester: Fall 2024 | Level: Undergraduate | Credits: 4

Introduction to designing effective digital learning experiences, including user experience principles, multimedia design, and assessment strategies for online environments.

title: Courses
text:
Past Courses

Educational Technology Foundations

Semester: Spring 2023 | Level: Graduate | Enrollment: 45 students

Foundational course covering the history, theory, and practice of educational technology in modern learning environments.


Research Methods in Education

Semester: Fall 2023 | Level: Graduate | Enrollment: 32 students

Comprehensive introduction to quantitative and qualitative research methodologies specifically applied to educational research contexts.

title: Virtuelle Akademie
text: The Virtual Academy (Virtuelle Akademie) is a research and development unit at the Bern University of Applied Sciences, focused on the intersection of technology and education.

title: Virtuelle Akademie
text: The Virtual Academy (Virtuelle Akademie) is a research and development unit at the Bern University of Applied Sciences, focused on the intersection of technology and education.

title: Virtuelle Akademie
text:
Our Team
Dr. Andrew Ellis and Dr. Stefan Hackstein are researchers at the Virtual Academy of the Bern University of Applied Sciences. Their research focuses on how artificial intelligence can be used effectively in educational systems.


Dr. Andrew Ellis
Researcher specializing in AI applications in educational technology and learning analytics.
 Contact |  Profile


Dr. Stefan Hackstein
Researcher focused on machine learning applications and intelligent tutoring systems.
 Contact |  Profile

title: Virtuelle Akademie
text:
Our Work
We explore innovative approaches to integrating artificial intelligence into educational contexts, developing tools and methodologies that enhance learning experiences and educational outcomes.

text:

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Research
text:
Featured Research Program

BeLEARN - Swiss Research Network

Program: Swiss National Research Network | Focus: Learning Sciences | Partnership: Multiple Swiss Universities

Our research contributes to BeLEARN, the Swiss research network dedicated to advancing the science of learning through interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation.
Visit BeLEARN Projects →


Current Projects
Explore our ongoing research initiatives and their progress in AI and educational technology.


Publications
Browse our academic publications and scholarly work in learning sciences.


Collaborations
Learn about research partnerships and collaborative efforts within the Swiss research landscape.

title: Teaching
text: This section contains information about courses, teaching philosophy, and educational resources focused on AI in education.

title: Teaching
text: This section contains information about courses, teaching philosophy, and educational resources focused on AI in education.

title: Teaching
text:
AI in Education Courses


KI in der Lehre - Intermediate

Level: Intermediate | Format: Interactive Workshop | Duration: Half-day

An intermediate-level course exploring practical applications of artificial intelligence in educational settings. Learn how to integrate AI tools effectively into your teaching practice.

Hands-on AI tool exploration
Practical implementation strategies
Interactive exercises and examples
Real-world case studies

Launch Intermediate Course →


KI in der Lehre - Advanced

Level: Advanced | Format: Interactive Workshop | Duration: Half-day

Advanced concepts and implementations of AI technologies in modern educational environments. Deep dive into sophisticated AI applications and pedagogical frameworks.

Advanced AI integration techniques
Ethical considerations and best practices
Custom AI workflow development
Assessment and evaluation methods

Launch Advanced Course →



Teaching Philosophy
Learn about our approach to education and student engagement in the digital age.


Resources
Access helpful resources for students and fellow educators interested in AI applications in education.

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text: Dr. Stefan Hackstein is a researcher at the Virtual Academy of the Bern University of Applied Sciences. His research focuses on how artificial intelligence can be used effectively in educational systems.

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text: Dr. Stefan Hackstein is a researcher at the Virtual Academy of the Bern University of Applied Sciences. His research focuses on how artificial intelligence can be used effectively in educational systems.

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text:
Research Interests

Artificial Intelligence in Education
Machine Learning Applications
Educational Data Mining
Intelligent Tutoring Systems
Technology-Enhanced Learning

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text:
Background
Dr. Hackstein specializes in the development and evaluation of AI-driven educational technologies. His work focuses on creating intelligent systems that can adapt to individual learning needs and provide personalized educational experiences.

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text:
Current Projects

Design of adaptive learning algorithms
Development of intelligent educational content systems
Research on AI-powered student assessment methods
Investigation of machine learning techniques for educational analytics

title: Dr. Stefan Hackstein
text:
Publications
Publications and research outputs will be updated regularly.

For research collaborations, inquiries, or more information about ongoing projects, please reach out via email.

Research Interests

Artificial Intelligence in Education

Adaptive Learning Systems
Human-Computer Interaction in Educational Contexts

title: Dr. Andrew Ellis
text:
Background
Dr. Ellis brings extensive experience in educational technology research, with a particular focus on the practical implementation of AI tools in learning environments. His work bridges the gap between theoretical AI research and real-world educational applications.

title: Dr. Andrew Ellis
text:
Current Projects

Development of AI-powered learning assessment tools
Integration of machine learning algorithms in educational platforms
Research on personalized learning pathways using AI
Collaboration on innovative teaching methodologies
